alert.note: Alert for Kings (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 7:53AM PST until March 10 at 11:15AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno, Kings and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 145 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 753 AM PST, gauge reports indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Rapid snowmelt is also occurring and will add to the flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Collins Creek, Mill Creek, Kings River, Zebe Creek and Hughes Creek. Flooding is occurring along the Kings river. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sanger, Reedley, Kingsburg and Laton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
